qas.question: Who met the British army as they moved north?

answers.text: the Southern Division of the Continental Army and local militia

qas.question: Who lost the battle of Cowpens?
Who led the British calvary at Cowpen?
What was the date of the battle of Cowpens?
What is another name for the race to the Dan?

context: The road to Yorktown and America's independence from Great Britain led through North Carolina. As the British Army moved north from victories in Charleston and Camden, South Carolina, <a0_0>the Southern Division of the Continental Army and local militia<a0_0/> prepared to meet them. Following General Daniel Morgan's victory over <a1_0>the British Cavalry<a1_0/> <a2_0>Commander Banastre Tarleton<a2_0/> at the Battle of Cowpens on <a3_0>January 17, 1781<a3_0/>, southern commander Nathanael Greene led British Lord Charles Cornwallis across the heartland of North Carolina, and away from the latter's base of supply in Charleston, South Carolina. This campaign is known as "The Race to the Dan" or "<a4_0>The Race for the River<a4_0/>."
